images.alt: A cute panda munching on bamboo
images.title: Bamboo Lover
images.description: Pandas can eat up to 38 kilograms (84 pounds) of bamboo a day!

images.title: Sleepy Pandas
images.description: Pandas spend 12-16 hours a day eating, and the rest of the time they are usually sleeping.

images.alt: A curious panda exploring its surroundings
images.title: Exploring Panda
images.description: Pandas have a great sense of smell, which helps them detect food and other pandas.

images.title: Tree Climber
images.description: Despite their weight, pandas are excellent climbers and can scale trees effortlessly.

images.alt: A playful panda rolling in the grass
images.title: Playful Panda
images.description: Pandas love to play and roll around; they have a playful nature, especially as cubs.

images.title: Sitting in Style
images.description: Pandas sit in an upright position while eating, a behavior not seen in many other animals.

images.alt: A panda with a serene look
images.title: Gentle Giant
images.description: Pandas are generally solitary and peaceful animals, spending their days in quiet forests.

images.title: The Bamboo Diet
images.description: Although pandas belong to the bear family, 99% of their diet consists of bamboo!

images.alt: A panda relaxing under a tree
images.title: A Relaxing Moment
images.description: Pandas are known for their relaxed and easy-going behavior, spending much of their time lounging.

images.title: A Solitary Life
images.description: Pandas are solitary animals and prefer to live alone, except during the mating season.

images.title: Thirsty Panda
images.description: While pandas primarily eat bamboo, they need to drink water from nearby streams or rivers daily.

images.alt: A panda cub climbing a branch
images.title: Adventurous Cub
images.description: Panda cubs are extremely playful and adventurous, often climbing trees and exploring their environment.
